title: Analog Design Lead - Power Management
summary: Can you influence, connect, get results and communicate effectively? We have an extraordinary opportunity for senior level engineers to drive and lead technical engagements between Apple and silicon and IP suppliers working on groundbreaking technologies! The Custom Silicon Management Group provides critical custom silicon for all mobile products including iPhone, iPad, iPod, and AppleTV. Apple is looking for a remarkable Power Management Analog Design Lead to work with multi-functional teams and external vendors to define, develop and productize the next generation of mobile power solutions.
description: Imagine yourself at the center of our hardware development effort! We collaborate with all teams, playing a strategic role of getting functional products to millions of customers quickly. As a key member of the team responsible for the delivery of high-quality, on-time silicon, that spans all aspects of power management architectural design and topologies, you will: -Work with Systems and Platform teams to establish silicon requirements. -Lead efforts that develop, integrate, characterize, and test devices that include power regulators, chargers, backlight drivers, boost converters. -Deliver first revision functional silicon and production worthy silicon per system requirements, on schedule. Work with external vendors to ensure innovative design practices, methodologies and processes are in place to produce quality results. -Work together with vendors to manage the development of new process technologies and next generation architectures and circuit designs. -Ensure designs are accurately verified, validated, and tested for long-term reliability. Support multi-functional engineering teams for system validation and mass production approval.
key_qualifications: We are looking for applicants with 10+ years of demonstrated ability of developing leading power management integrated solutions implemented in silicon for the mobile market with the following experience: BS+10 Years of relevant industry experience, advanced degree preferred. Expertise in power topologies such as buck, boost, buck-boost, charge pumps, LDOs. Deep understanding of control architectures such as current mode, voltage mode, and hysteretic mode for applications include DC/DC converters, LED drivers, battery management circuits, LDOs, temperature sensors...
education_experience: BS+10 Years of relevant industry experience

The base pay range for this role is between $165,500 and $293,800, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.
